metadata.title: CVE-2024-21011 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the Oracle Java SE, Oracle GraalVM for JDK, Oracle GraalVMEnterprise Edition product of Oracle Java SE (component: Hotspot).Supported versions that are affected are Oracle Java SE: 8u401, 8u401-perf,11.0.22, 17.0.10, 21.0.2, 22; Oracle GraalVM for JDK: 17.0.10, 21.0.2, 22;Oracle GraalVM Enterprise Edition: 20.3.13 and 21.3.9. Difficult to exploitvulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network access viamultiple protocols to compromise Oracle Java SE, Oracle GraalVM for JDK,Oracle GraalVM Enterprise Edition. Successful attacks of this vulnerabilitycan result in unauthorized ability to cause a partial denial of service(partial DOS) of Oracle Java SE, Oracle GraalVM for JDK, Oracle GraalVMEnterprise Edition. Note: This vulnerability can be exploited by using APIsin the specified Component, e.g., through a web service which supplies datato the APIs. This vulnerability also applies to Java deployments, typicallyin clients running sandboxed Java Web Start applications or sandboxed Javaapplets, that load and run untrusted code (e.g., code that comes from theinternet) and rely on the Java sandbox for security. CVSS 3.1 Base Score3.7 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:L).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-21011` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openjdk-11-demo - 11.0.23+9-1ubuntu1
openjdk-11-jdk - 11.0.23+9-1ubuntu1
openjdk-11-jdk-headless - 11.0.23+9-1ubuntu1
openjdk-11-jre - 11.0.23+9-1ubuntu1
openjdk-11-jre-headless - 11.0.23+9-1ubuntu1
openjdk-11-jre-zero - 11.0.23+9-1ubuntu1
openjdk-11-source - 11.0.23+9-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

openjdk-17-demo - 17.0.11+9-1
openjdk-17-jdk - 17.0.11+9-1
openjdk-17-jdk-headless - 17.0.11+9-1
openjdk-17-jre - 17.0.11+9-1
openjdk-17-jre-headless - 17.0.11+9-1
openjdk-17-jre-zero - 17.0.11+9-1
openjdk-17-source - 17.0.11+9-1
No subscription required

openjdk-21-demo - 21.0.3+9-1
openjdk-21-jdk - 21.0.3+9-1
openjdk-21-jdk-headless - 21.0.3+9-1
openjdk-21-jre - 21.0.3+9-1
openjdk-21-jre-headless - 21.0.3+9-1
openjdk-21-jre-zero - 21.0.3+9-1
openjdk-21-source - 21.0.3+9-1
openjdk-21-testsupport - 21.0.3+9-1
No subscription required

openjdk-22-demo - 22.0.1+8-1
openjdk-22-jdk - 22.0.1+8-1
openjdk-22-jdk-headless - 22.0.1+8-1
openjdk-22-jre - 22.0.1+8-1

openjdk-22-jre-zero - 22.0.1+8-1
openjdk-22-source - 22.0.1+8-1
openjdk-22-testsupport - 22.0.1+8-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjdk-8 package in oracular is affected and needs fixing.
openjdk-lts package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '11.0.23+9-1ubuntu1').
openjdk-17 package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '17.0.11+9-1').
openjdk-21 package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '21.0.3+9-1').
openjdk-22 package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '22.0.1+8-1').
